thread.title: John Terry set for Chelsea return in the FA Cup
thread.title_full: John Terry set for Chelsea return in the FA Cup

title: John Terry set for Chelsea return in the FA Cup
text:
John Terry set for Chelsea return in the FA Cup Getty Images 0 Jan 6, 2017 6:02:26 PM The Blues captain is fit and is expected to start against Peterborough as they look to rest players against lower league opposition in the cup 
John Terry is fit to start for Chelsea against Peterborough United after completing a successful comeback from glute injury that he sustained in training last month. 
The Chelsea captain has not feature for his club since they were knocked out of the EFL Cup in a 2-1 defeat to West Ham United back in October, but looks set to return as Antonio Conte aims to rest players after a busy festive period in the Premier League. 
Man City go from crisis to cruise control 
The 36-year-old has been training for a couple of weeks and was travelling with Chelsea's first team to matches even when he was not fit. Ahead of the FA Cup clash against Posh, Conte confirmed the news that Terry is likely to return. 
"Yes [he can play," Conte said at a news conference at Cobham Training Centre. "John is in a good shape and he’s ready to play. He’s doing great work on the pitch and outside the pitch. It’s important to underline this." A video posted by John Terry (@johnterry.26) on Dec 29, 2016 at 1:56am PST 
Terry teased that his return was close by posting a goal similar to that of Marco Van Basten's famous volley from the 1988 European Championship final, but Conte was hesitant to confirm for certain that his captain would start - having already named Michy Batshuayi and Kurt Zouma as certainties. 
"Now we [have named] two players: Michy and Zouma," Conte added. "If we continue maybe you know exactly what our starting XI is!" 
However, Terry is expected to be another name on the team-sheet as Conte will likely rest David Luiz who has played every game in December, despite him carrying a minor injury. Related
